review_text: Cuantos is the best tacos in Texas, and the best tacos in the United States. Cuatos para vida! Everything is excellent. The tortillas are thin and delicate, the meat is dynamic and tender, and the salsas are refined and wonderful. Unlike the rest of Mexican food in Texas which disgraces authentic Mexican cuisine, Cuantos does it right. This is how Mexico-City style tacos are meant to be.

THE BEST tacos I've ever had in Austin. I'm from a south Texas border town and have had amazing street tacos. These compare! I got the 4 taco special, and ordered carnitas, suadero, and cachete topped with REAL Mexican cheese (maybe panela or queso fresco)  and avocado, OMG! If I could redo my order I'd get just cachete. ::chefs kiss:: So well seasoned, tacos packed with meat, fresh ingredients, just perfect.

I tried the tacos at the recommendation of a friend, but they didn't quite live up to my expectations. The beef cheek and pork stomach tacos were indeed flavorful, but I found them to be overly savory for my taste. On the plus side, the price was reasonable, with two tacos totaling $5. Overall, it's worth a try if you love intense flavors, but it wasn't my personal favorite.

This food truck in little park was very good we only tried one taco as we had tried too much food other places in Austin suadero taco was great good filling n good sauce flavorful tasty delicious enjoyed the flavor

Really good! Line was short, the ambiance was outside, very outdoorsy.

Tastes amazing, def recommend for anyone thinkin about swinging by. Good price as well

Delicious Mexico City style street tacos with homemade nixta corn tortillas! Each taco is $2.50 but you need quite a few for a full meal.

The tiny tacos have doubled corn tortillas to hold the juicy meats packed with flavor. They also sprinkle some cilantro and onion, in true street taco style.

Def worth a visit and easy to see why cuantos tacos is one of the top taco spots in the city!

First time here last week and was not disappointed. The line moved pretty quickly and the service was great! They even have a speaker to call our names when it's loud which I think is so smart lol. Also have a crate to recycle glass next to the trash can, so less goes to landfill! The tacos were great, we got a variety of like 4 kinds and honestly I can't remember which exactly but they were all great!

The tacos here are amazing. They are very tiny, only 2-3 bites per taco so order plenty! My only negative comment is they ALWAYS get my online order wrong. So, don't be lazy and be sure check your order before you leave because they always leave out tacos from my order (one time, they literally gave me half of what I ordered) and as I mentioned above, these tacos are small so leaving some out will leave you hungry!

My first taco experience in Austin and WOOOOWWW. I have yet to find a better taco! So simple yet so flavorful and juicy. They are on the smaller side but trust me - they are so worth it. The carnitas are dripping down your arm, licking your fingers, wanting to order 5 more type of good.

Quick food truck service and super easy to grab and go or eat at the picnic tables out front- very casual. Part of a food truck park on E 12th - lots of parking. I just learned you can order ahead on their website too!

During a short day trip to Austin I decided to try the Al pastor tacos (plate of 4) and it was sooo good. They come on a styrofoam tray covered with foil. Inside are 4 delicious street taco style Al pastor tacos with two different salsas. Delicious and greasy and full of flavor. They're also very quick to put out the order, but we came a little after the lunch rush.

All in all, great authentic tasting tacos and very quick to put out food!

After hearing so many people claiming that Cuantos Tacos is their favorite taco place in Austin (or Texas, even!), I finally got a chance to give it a try. I ordered the "one of everything" option, and I must say, the portions are tiny. And what was even more unfortunate... was that I didn't get the hype :( Every single taco was way too salty for me, to the point where I couldn't even finish my food.

I'm so glad I got the 1 of each option! If I hadn't of I probably wouldn't have ordered my favorite which was the buche and champinones. The tacos are mini so keep that in mind when ordering. Each taco I tasted was packed with flavor! The sauces were also both amazing. We visited during the week when they first open and didn't have to deal with a crowd. I've eaten at the food park before and have seen the spot completely full on the weekend. I'm so glad I finally checked this Taco Mafia spot off my list! It was legit and lived up to everything I could have hoped for! Go ahead and call me a regular because I'll be back!

An unassuming spot to inhale 6 tacos made perfectly: just meat (or mushrooms) with onions and cilantro. The costra tacos are my favorite but everything is delicious. My sister loved the lengua when she visited. My go-to casual taco spot in Austin (which is really saying something given options)!

Food and service were great. HOWEVER, the next day my card was suddenly being used to purchase things on Walmart.com. I hadn't used my card for anything prior to that so.... Hmmmm. Not saying they did it, but sure begs the question. Just beware.
Best tacos and consistency ever! We love this place. Very authentic and simple. Always great

come for the buche,
stay for the buche,
have more of the buche
I needed 24 more characters - buche

I recently visited Cuantos Tacos, and I must say it was a decent experience! I paid $24.25 for 8 delightful tacos and an order of chile toreados. From the array of options including buche, suadero, carnitas, mushroom, and longaniza, my personal favorites turned out to be the carnitas and longaniza tacos. Despite their smaller size, the tacos were tasty. The taco truck is conveniently located in a charming food park with outdoor seating and plenty of private parking. It's a cute spot to enjoy some tacos.
Great price for great tacos. Wait time was about 20 minutes. The service was friendly and the menu was very easy. So far some of my fav street tacos in Austin

Not much to say that everyone else here hasn't. In my opinion the best tacos in ATX. Absolutely incredible flavor. I'm not sure how they get these flavors into their meat but what an experience eating lunch there. Top notch.
Not bad for a taco truck. The food came out in 15 minutes and we ate right outside by the table around the area.
